intro: Sphaerocephalus hypoleucus, commonly known as the white-flowered sphaerocephalus, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
